Name: ggs_team_id_tooltip
English: 10 digit alpha-numeric identifier taken from your developer.apple.com/#/overview URL. If blank this will inherit the value set in Platform Options
Translation: 10 digit alpha-numeric identifier taken from your developer.apple.com/#/overview URL. If blank this will inherit the value set in Platform Options

Name: ggs_signing_id_tooltip
English:
To distribute your title outside of the Mac App Store macOS requires that your
package is codesigned. Please provide the signing identity that you wish to use
here: this should be a Developer ID Application identity and should be present
in your Mac's login keychain certificates. Signing identities can be easily created
in Xcode->Preferences->Accounts->Team->View Details->Developer ID
Application->Create. Signing identities will be matched so the default value
should be sufficient if you are only the member of one development team.
Translation:
To distribute your title outside of the Mac App Store macOS requires that your
package is codesigned. Please provide the signing identity that you wish to use
here: this should be a Developer ID Application identity and should be present
in your Mac's login keychain certificates. Signing identities can be easily created
in Xcode->Preferences->Accounts->Team->View Details->Developer ID
Application->Create. Signing identities will be matched so the default value
should be sufficient if you are only the member of one development team.

Comment: message box title when the project directory has been reconnected due to a buffer overflow

Check any proxy or VPN is not blocking GameMaker access.

On Mac - /Users/Shared/GameMakerStudio2
On PC - C:\ProgramData\GameMakerStudio2

Name: IDEMenu_Help_CreateBugReport
Comment: menu item for creating and sending a bug report

Name: BugReport_Overall
English: Thank you for taking the time to report an issue you have found in GameMaker. Submitting a Bug Report - What Does It Contain?
Translation: Thank you for taking the time to report an issue you have found in GameMaker. Submitting a Bug Report - What Does It Contain?

Name: BugReport_KnownIssues
English: Please check the Known Issues before submitting to make sure that it has not already been reported.
Translation: Please check the Known Issues before submitting to make sure that it has not already been reported.

Name: BugReport_AuthGithub
English: You can authorise your GitHub account to post issues on the Accounts page
Translation: You can authorise your GitHub account to post issues on the Accounts page

Name: BugReport_DescriptionText
English: Describe the issue in as much detail as possible, the more details you supply, the more likely we are able to fix the problem. Include details such as: what you were doing at the time, and target platforms being used.
Translation: Describe the issue in as much detail as possible, the more details you supply, the more likely we are able to fix the problem. Include details such as: what you were doing at the time, and target platforms being used.

Name: BugReport_DescWarning
English: Please complete the fields marked * to submit
Translation: Please complete the fields marked * to submit

Name: BugReport_StepsTT
English: Describe the steps required to reproduce the bug
Translation: Describe the steps required to reproduce the bug

Name: BugReport_AttachFilesTT
English: A selection of GameMaker files (ui.log, um.json, licence.plist, etc) will be included within your bug report, these are required to allow us to diagnose the issue you are reporting.
Translation: A selection of GameMaker files (ui.log, um.json, licence.plist, etc) will be included within your bug report, these are required to allow us to diagnose the issue you are reporting.

Name: BugReport_IncludeProjectTT
English: Include a copy of your project file with your submission, please try to refrain from submitting full game projects, and please do create a small sample project that reproduces the issue. If you are unable to recreate the issue in a new project, then it is likely that the issue is caused by your game logic.
Translation: Include a copy of your project file with your submission, please try to refrain from submitting full game projects, and please do create a small sample project that reproduces the issue. If you are unable to recreate the issue in a new project, then it is likely that the issue is caused by your game logic.

Name: BugReport_PublicTT
English: Whenever possible, please do not include sensitive/confidential information in your description or steps, so that you can report your issue publicly and be able to see it on our website and get updates. (Your attached files will always be private anyway.)
Translation: Whenever possible, please do not include sensitive/confidential information in your description or steps, so that you can report your issue publicly and be able to see it on our website and get updates. (Your attached files will always be private anyway.)

Name: BugReport_PrivateTT
English: If your issue contains sensitive information (e.g. information covered by an NDA) and you would like us not to include this report in the public bug list, then please select this. Please note that if the issue would affect lots of users, we retain the right to redact all private information and make the issue public.
Translation: If your issue contains sensitive information (e.g. information covered by an NDA) and you would like us not to include this report in the public bug list, then please select this. Please note that if the issue would affect lots of users, we retain the right to redact all private information and make the issue public.

Name: BugPackageModule_IncludeYYZ
English:
Include the current package:

Would you like to include this project in your bug submission as an example of how to cause the bug?


A project is usually required for all issues regarding compiling and is extremely helpful when the problem is in-game.

If you do not include a sample project, we may request one later if we are unable to reproduce your bug.
Translation:
Include the current package:

Would you like to include this project in your bug submission as an example of how to cause the bug?


A project is usually required for all issues regarding compiling and is extremely helpful when the problem is in-game.

If you do not include a sample project, we may request one later if we are unable to reproduce your bug.
Comment: Message to include a YYZ of the project
